alert.note: Alert for Dooly (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Dooly and southeastern Sumter Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 651 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong storm within a tropical rain band over Chokee, or 13 miles northeast of Leesburg, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Enhanced risk of a brief tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Storms embedded within a tropical rainband have exhibited localized rotation. A brief tornado could quickly form. Locations impacted include... Leslie, De Soto, Desoto, Cobb, Lamar and Drayton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for central and west central Georgia.
